rooms.name: Home Office
roomDescription: For those who have a dedicated home office, it’s essential to design it in a way that lets you work as efficiently and securely as any corporate office—not to mention, more comfortably.
With the luxury of a little extra space, you can outfit your home office with devices that give you the flexibility to take one meeting at your desk and another on a bigger screen.

rooms.name: Kitchen
roomDescription: Not everyone has the luxury of a dedicated home office. For many of us, our kitchens have become our place to work. These tight—and often temporary workspaces—also include a recipe of distractions, noise, and guest appearances.
But when you mix portable collaboration devices with noise-cancelling headsets and a sprinkle of secure wireless connectivity, voila! Your kitchen becomes a productive powerhouse.

rooms.name: Hot Desk
roomDescription: With most employees splitting time between the home and office, hot desking has never been more in-demand. The key is to equip these spaces for maximum productivity, so the rotating cast of employees and visitors never skips a beat.
That means arming this room with devices that lets them be instantly productive, while giving them the ability to just as instantly pack up and leave.

rooms.name: Ideation Space
roomDescription: Ideas can spark from anywhere, at any time. Having a dedicated space in your office for people to connect, co-create, share ideas, and solve problems makes sure none of that brilliance gets lost.
Devices purpose-built for this type of creativity are key to bringing everyone together, whether they are remote or sitting in the same room.

rooms.name: Small Conference Room
roomDescription: The majority of meetings today will include remote participants, making it essential to rethink traditional conference rooms. Often the staple of an office, these spaces need to create an inclusive experience for all participants—whether in-office or remote—at the same time ensuring the people in the room feel safe in an enclosed area.

rooms.name: Cafe
roomDescription: Busy, noisy spaces like coffee shops used to be off limits for collaborating. Not only is it loud and distracting, but it can make it too hard to be heard during important calls. And to stay connected on the go, there’s often additional devices—both work and personal—you need to carry with you.
Not anymore. Webex makes it easy to stay focused, be heard, and travel light when you’re working away from your desk.
